definitions.definition: Government by bureaus or their administrators or officers.

(organizational theory) A system of administration based upon organisation into bureaus, division of labour, a hierarchy of authority, etc., designed to dispose of a large body of work in a routine manner.
definitions.example: At that time the administration replaced the system of patronage in the civil service with a bureaucracy.

definitions.definition: The body of officers and administrators, especially of a government.
definitions.example: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy. (apocryphal quip)

definitions.definition: Excessive red tape and routine in any administration, body or behaviour.
definitions.example: The head of the civil service promised to clamp down on bureaucracy.
